result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian Patrick Rubusch was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brian Patrick Rubusch was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond on file in 22CM133 to be applied to amounts due. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation in 22CM22 and count #3 in this case. Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

HUBER provision eliminated per letter request of defendant. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant may be serving.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file in 22CM133 to be applied to amounts due. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall comply with the terms of the injunction in 22CV2.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with MJR or her residence except as authorized by his probation agent.

Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian Patrick Rubusch in court, in custody. Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Brian Patrick Rubusch. Statements by counsel and defendanton sentence. Defendant sentenced. Def stipulates that cash bond on file in 22CM133 can be applied to amounts due in 22CM22, 22CM260 and 22CM418.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact w/MJR or her residence. Comply w/injunction in 22CV2 Doc #8 deleted and rescanned as Doc #9

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian Patrick Rubusch in court, in custody. Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Brian Patrick Rubusch. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Agreement reached on all cases. Def pleads guilty to count #1 and #3; def is convicted. Counts #2, #4 and #5 are dismissed and read in. Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Per request of Atty Weil and no objection by DA, the initial appearance is rescheduled from June 6, 2022 at 9:45 am to June 8, 2022 at 9:45 am for anticipated resolution with other cases.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
